item.title: A Touch of Applesoft BASIC
item.description: A Touch of Applesoft BASIC came with the Apple IIc Plus that I excitedly received early in the mornning on Christmas day in 1988. Due to games like Oregon Trail and Think Quick! I am certain that I didn’t even open it until several years later. Before reading this book I did not understand that it was practical for a normal person to write a program and run it on a computer.

item.title: Getting Started in Electronics
item.description: I aquired Getting Started in Electronics at the local Radio Shack in the mid 1990’s. It taught me the difference between series and parallel circuits and how different electrical components function. Mr. Mim’s handwritten text and diagrams made it less intimidating to learn about this complex subject. The last chapter in the book has many projects and I successfully built the one called ‘Mini Radio Transmitter’ which simply sent an adjustable tone to a nearby radio.
